column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Fixes #105
username_0: 
<issue_comment>username_1: `Headers` are not needed for public project, so it's just for this particular case. I think it would be better adding note about that (or extend example) rather than removing this parameter.
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_1 I see. You seem to know what you're doing then and I guess was trying to be over-helpful. :wink: 

I ended up turning your sample into a PowerShell function called `Get-AppVeyorArtifacts` for my eventual use but which is generally reusable:

```ps1
function Get-AppVeyorArtifacts
{
    [CmdletBinding(SupportsShouldProcess = $true, ConfirmImpact = 'Low')]
    param(
        [parameter(Mandatory = $true)]
        [string]$Account,
        [parameter(Mandatory = $true)]
        [string]$Project,
        [parameter(Mandatory = $true)]
        [string]$Token,
        [string]$DownloadDirectory,
        [switch]$Flat,
        [string]$Proxy,
        [switch]$ProxyUseDefaultCredentials)

    $apiUrl = 'https://ci.appveyor.com/api'

    $headers = @{
        'Authorization' = "Bearer $token"
        'Content-type' = 'application/json'
    }

    # Prepare proxy args to splat to Invoke-RestMethod

    $proxyArgs = @{}
    if (-not [string]::IsNullOrEmpty($proxy)) {
        $proxyArgs.Add('Proxy', $proxy)    
    }        
    if ($proxyUseDefaultCredentials.IsPresent) {
        $proxyArgs.Add('ProxyUseDefaultCredentials', $proxyUseDefaultCredentials)
    }

    $downloadDirectory = @($downloadDirectory, '.')[[string]::IsNullOrEmpty($downloadDirectory)]
    $errorActionPreference = 'Stop'

    $projectObject = Invoke-RestMethod -Method Get -Uri "$apiUrl/projects/$account/$project" `
                                       -Headers $headers @proxyArgs

    $jobId = $projectObject.build.jobs[0].jobId # assume build has a single job

    $artifacts = Invoke-RestMethod -Method Get -Uri "$apiUrl/buildjobs/$jobId/artifacts" `
                                   -Headers $headers @proxyArgs
    $artifacts `
    | ? { $psCmdlet.ShouldProcess($_.fileName) } `
    | % {

        $type = $_.type

        $localArtifactPath = $_.fileName -split '/' | % { [Uri]::UnescapeDataString($_) }
        if ($flat.IsPresent) {
            $localArtifactPath = ($localArtifactPath | select -Last 1)
        } else {
            $localArtifactPath = $localArtifactPath -join [IO.Path]::DirectorySeparatorChar
        }
        $localArtifactPath = Join-Path $downloadDirectory $localArtifactPath

        $artifactUrl = "$apiUrl/buildjobs/$jobId/artifacts/$($_.fileName)"
        Write-Verbose "Downloading $artifactUrl to $localArtifactPath"
            
        Invoke-RestMethod -Method Get -Uri $artifactUrl -OutFile $localArtifactPath @proxyArgs

        New-Object PSObject -Property @{
            'Source' = $artifactUrl
            'Type'   = $type
            'Target' = $localArtifactPath 
        }
    }
}
```

A sample usage would be:

```ps1
Get-AppVeyorArtifacts ACCOUNT PROJECT -Token TOKEN -Flat `
    -DownloadDirectory $env:Temp `
    -Proxy http://proxy.example.com:8080/ -ProxyUseDefaultCredentials 
```

However, I'm guessing this is probably too complex (incidental, not accidental) for what you want in your docs so I'm happy to close this PR if that's the case. You did talk about *extending the example* so just sharing it here & letting you decide what you want to do with it.
<issue_comment>username_1: I've published your example as "advanced" so this PR may be closed: http://www.appveyor.com/docs/api/samples/download-artifacts-advanced-ps

Thank you!

[{'action': 'opened', 'author': 'ncksllvn', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2019-11-21T22:10:15Z', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': "## Description
This pull request implements the foundation of the widget on the new `Find VA forms` page. This work will be a widget on that page. Everything from the URL to the design is prone to change.

This PR:
- Sets up the static-page widget code
- Adds the basic UI look and feel
- Sets up Redux w/the query and query change behavior

This PR does not integrate at all with the API. That will be done later. This doesn't need to be done behind feature flag, because it isn't an app and nothing references it.

Ticket - https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/issues/3605

## Testing done 
Added unit tests for reducers, actions, components, and containers

To run this:
1. You need the Drupal page data. Right now it exists as a draft only in Drupal prod, so you can't pull it. As a workaround, maually add this [data](https://app.zenhub.com/files/133843125/e7361fa8-a6d2-4878-96e4-fc92be49d8ff/download) into your `vets-website/.cache/localhost/drupal/pages.json`.
1. Start the site - `npm run watch:static`
1. Navigate to `http://localhost:3001/find-va-forms/`

## Screenshots

This PR contains everything in the gray box, as well as the blue boxes under the `Top tasks for frequently downloaded VA forms` section.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1915775/69464289-e7bf3e80-0d4b-11ea-9165-9aa5535b1e42.png)


## Acceptance criteria
- [x] Widgets renders and doesn't look too bad

## Definition of done
- [x] Events are logged appropriately
- [x] Documentation has been updated, if applicable
- [ ] A link has been provided to the Pre-Launch Checklist
- [x] A link has been provided to the originating GitHub issue (or connected to it via ZenHub)
- [ ] A link has been provided to the VSA-QA Test Plan ticket \[use the VSA-QA Test Plan Issue Template to create the ticket within va.gov-team repo].
- [ ] A link has been provided to the VSA-QA Test-Request ticket \[issue-template coming soon].
- [x] No sensitive information (i.e. PII/credentials/internal URLs/etc.) is captured in logging, hardcoded, or specs", 'title': '[Find VA Forms] New widget scaffolding', 'type': 'issue'}

That component may end up being migrated to the design system though so it may be used in other ways, so I added the support now just in case", 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}

column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: [Find VA Forms] New widget scaffolding
username_0: ## Description
This pull request implements the foundation of the widget on the new `Find VA forms` page. This work will be a widget on that page. Everything from the URL to the design is prone to change.

This PR:
- Sets up the static-page widget code
- Adds the basic UI look and feel
- Sets up Redux w/the query and query change behavior

This PR does not integrate at all with the API. That will be done later. This doesn't need to be done behind feature flag, because it isn't an app and nothing references it.

Ticket - https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/issues/3605

## Testing done 
Added unit tests for reducers, actions, components, and containers

To run this:
1. You need the Drupal page data. Right now it exists as a draft only in Drupal prod, so you can't pull it. As a workaround, maually add this [data](https://app.zenhub.com/files/133843125/e7361fa8-a6d2-4878-96e4-fc92be49d8ff/download) into your `vets-website/.cache/localhost/drupal/pages.json`.
1. Start the site - `npm run watch:static`
1. Navigate to `http://localhost:3001/find-va-forms/`

## Screenshots

This PR contains everything in the gray box, as well as the blue boxes under the `Top tasks for frequently downloaded VA forms` section.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1915775/69464289-e7bf3e80-0d4b-11ea-9165-9aa5535b1e42.png)


## Acceptance criteria
- [x] Widgets renders and doesn't look too bad

## Definition of done
- [x] Events are logged appropriately
- [x] Documentation has been updated, if applicable
- [ ] A link has been provided to the Pre-Launch Checklist
- [x] A link has been provided to the originating GitHub issue (or connected to it via ZenHub)
- [ ] A link has been provided to the VSA-QA Test Plan ticket \[use the VSA-QA Test Plan Issue Template to create the ticket within va.gov-team repo].
- [ ] A link has been provided to the VSA-QA Test-Request ticket \[issue-template coming soon].
- [x] No sensitive information (i.e. PII/credentials/internal URLs/etc.) is captured in logging, hardcoded, or specs
<issue_comment>username_0: @Mottie You're correct! That component may end up being migrated to the design system though so it may be used in other ways, so I added the support now just in case
<issue_comment>username_0: @department-of-veterans-affairs/frontend-review-group could I have a review on this soon? 🙂
<issue_comment>username_0: Thanks @bkjohnson!  I did, yeah. It's just a placeholder for now. It being empty is a testament to how powerful our design system's utility classes are though 🙂 CC @jaredcunha-usds

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Added a page describing the expected powershell security settings
username_0: This PR adds a page to the docs to describe some PowerShell pitfalls and the PowerShell environment that the docs expect.
<issue_comment>username_1: @username_0 your changes have now been merged and will be avail with next publish of the site, thanks for contributing 👍
<issue_comment>username_0: Thanks @username_1

If you are ready, please edit your config file to have your organizer info, like this: https://github.com/devopsdays/devopsdays-web/blob/master/data/events/2019-zurich.yml#L38-L158", 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'} {'action': 'created', 'author': 'RomanoRoth', 'comment_id': 529304526.0, 'datetime': '2019-09-09 05:24:15+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': '@username_2 here we go: - name: "Martin Thalmann" \xa0 \xa0 twitter: "martin_thalmann" \xa0 \xa0 employer: "Swisscom AG" \xa0 \xa0 bio: "I’m a passionate DevOps Enthusiast who strongly believes in the power of this movement. I’m currently helping a Swiss telco operator in adapting DevOps principles in a large enterprise. Beside that I’m co-organizer of the [DevOps Enthusiast Meetup in Zurich](https://www.meetup.com/DevOps-Meetup-Zurich/). I do have a background as a Software Engineer and experience in several Line- and Project-Management positions." \xa0 \xa0 github: "" \xa0 \xa0 facebook: "" \xa0 \xa0 linkedin: "https://www.linkedin.com/in/martinthalmann/" \xa0 \xa0 website: "" \xa0 \xa0 image: "martin-thalmann.jpg" \xa0 - name: "Dirk Lehmann" \xa0 \xa0 bio: "

Dirk is a DevOps evangelist and Continuous Delivery expert at SAP.

Since 2001 Dirk worked in various roles at SAP including Development and Operations.
Together with his former team \"TwoGo by SAP\" he established the first Continuous Delivery implementation at SAP, delivering value daily to their customers.

In his current role, Dirk is a Cloud Quality Coach at SAP with focus on Continuous Delivery and DevOps practices.

Dirk is a frequent speaker at international conferences on DevOps and Continuous Delivery.

" \xa0 \xa0 twitter: "doergn" \xa0 \xa0 linkedin: "https://www.linkedin.com/in/dirk-lehmann-7712bb125/" \xa0 \xa0 image: "dirk-lehmann.jpg" \xa0 - name: "Nadine Biedermann" \xa0 \xa0 bio: "

Metaphorically, Nadine can conquer the world with her clever quips and her charme. Literally, Nadine's wit and her creativity will enhance your Marketing and Social Media experience of the DevOpsDays 2019.

" \xa0 \xa0 linkedin: "https://www.linkedin.com/in/nadine-biedermann-46436516b" \xa0 \xa0 image: "nadine-biedermann.jpg" \xa0 - name: "Romano Roth" \xa0 \xa0 bio: "

I'm an experienced software consultant and DevOps enthusiast working at Zühlke. My passion lies in radically transforming monolithic waterfall IT organizations into scalable agile teams doing DevOps.

" \xa0 \xa0 image: "romano-roth.jpg" \xa0 \xa0 employer: "Zühlke" \xa0 \xa0 twitter: "username_0" \xa0 \xa0 linkedin: "https://www.linkedin.com/in/romanoroth/" \xa0 - name: Carsten Plum \xa0 \xa0 bio: "

I am passionate about everything agile and human centered. Having started my career in an old school waterfall environment more than 20 years ago as a software engineer and project manager, I am now happy to enable teams and large organisations to establish agile methods and DevOps. I specifically like the combination (and challenges) of technical and cultural aspects.

" \xa0 \xa0 Website: https://www.xing.com/profile/Carsten_Plum2/ \xa0 \xa0 image: "carsten-plum.jpg" \xa0 - name: "Selina Reist" \xa0 \xa0 employer: "Federal Office of Information Technology" \xa0 \xa0 bio: "

I am an enthusiast for everything visual:photography, movies and animations, pictograms, infofraphics, visual design, graphical recordings, UX-Design. I also like to combine these skills in crossfunctional teams to enable app development, transformation processes and last but not least communicate and teach DevOps practices in large federal organizations

" \xa0 \xa0 image: "selina-reist.jpg" \xa0 - name: Lorena Dütsch \xa0 \xa0 bio: "

TBD

" \xa0 \xa0 Website: \xa0 \xa0 image: "lorena-dutsch.jpg" \xa0 - name: "Tobias Weinmann" \xa0 \xa0 bio: "Having worked as a developer, systems engineer and team lead in IT operations, the ideas and concepts behind DevOps are very close to my heart. As I am passionate about coding since my teenage years, I am fascinated by concepts like Infrastructure as Code, Social Coding, and cloud native technologies trying to get hands-on whenever possible. I enjoy lateral thinking and my basic premise is that \"we cannot solve our problems with the same thinking we used when we created them\" (Albert Einstein). In my current role I dedicate all my energy to introducing and spreading DevOps principles and practices in the broader organization." \xa0 \xa0 linkedin: "https://www.linkedin.com/in/tobias-weinmann" \xa0 \xa0 twitter: "Wankinobi75" \xa0 \xa0 github: "tweinmann" \xa0 \xa0 image: "tobias-weinmann.jpg" \xa0 - name: "Noëmi Kruesi" \xa0 \xa0 twitter: "" \xa0 \xa0 employer: "Swisscom AG" \xa0 \xa0 bio: "

It is a well-known fact that girls just wanna have fun. It is also known that companies that incorporate DevOps get more done. How do these two facts relate, you ask?

Meet Noëmi Krüsi, a girl who gets stuff done. Her strengths and talents lie in design and administration. As a creative allrounder she will be assisting with the design and social media of the DevOpsDays 2018.

" \xa0 \xa0 github: "" \xa0 \xa0 facebook: "" \xa0 \xa0 linkedin: "https://www.linkedin.com/in/noëmi-krüsi-992436127/" \xa0 \xa0 website: "" \xa0 \xa0 image: "noemi-krusi.jpg" - name: "Matías E. Fernández" \xa0 \xa0 twitter: "matiasfrndz" \xa0 \xa0 employer: "Swisscom AG" \xa0 \xa0 bio: "DevOps evangelist, Kanban practitioner, Lean Startup advocate, Linux and OSS afficionado.

Keen learner and challenger of the status quo.

Enabling organisations to achieve outstanding and sustainable results that exceed customers’ expectations is his passion." \xa0 \xa0 github: "matiasfrndz" \xa0 \xa0 facebook: "" \xa0 \xa0 linkedin: "https://www.linkedin.com/in/matiasfrndz/" \xa0 \xa0 website: "https://matiasfrndz.ch/" \xa0 \xa0 image: "matias-e-fernandez.jpg" - name: "Tobias Brunner" \xa0 \xa0 twitter: "tobruzh" \xa0 \xa0 employer: "VSHN AG" \xa0 \xa0 bio: "Tobias (aka tobru) is a DevOps Engineer and Partner at VSHN and one of the founding members of VSHN. He loves Open Source and everything about state-of-the-art technologies like Docker, Kubernetes and OpenShift. In his day job he is responsible for the Container Platform team at VSHN, works on the next big thing and brings APPUiO - The Swiss Container Platform - to the next level." \xa0 \xa0 github: "tobru" \xa0 \xa0 facebook: "" \xa0 \xa0 linkedin: "https://www.linkedin.com/in/tobru/" \xa0 \xa0 website: "https://tobru.ch/" \xa0 \xa0 image: "tobias-brunner.jpg" \xa0- name: "Julia Faust" \xa0 \xa0 bio: "

Julia loves to communicate and to bring people and solutions together. As a Financial Controller for the IT development department of a Swiss Telco, she accompanies the transformation into an agile setup from the beginning.

DevOps principles such as \"build it, run it\", autonomy of the team, as well as short and reasonable planning processes motivate her a lot. Julia is thrilled by discussing the basic ideas and causes of agility and to inspire others.

" \xa0 \xa0 image: "julia-faust.jpg" \xa0 - name: "Vittorio Boccone" \xa0 \xa0 twitter: "drbokko" \xa0 \xa0 employer: "Dectris Ltd." \xa0 \xa0 bio: "Vittorio grew up in the a world where hardware and software are in perfect equilibrium. At 8 he started customizing and modifying anything with an engine or a CPU. Curious about the nature of things he later became a detector and accelerator physicist. After 13 years at CERN, he's now often seen at Dectris happily developing Dectris X-ray detectors. He's comfortable with any lab equipment, programming language or particle accelerator." \xa0 \xa0 github: "https://github.com/drbokko" \xa0 \xa0 facebook: "" \xa0 \xa0 linkedin: "https://www.linkedin.com/in/vittorio-boccone-1998a94/" \xa0 \xa0 website: "" \xa0 \xa0 image: "vittorio-boccone.jpg"', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'} {'action': 'created', 'author': 'RomanoRoth', 'comment_id': 529325118.0, 'datetime': '2019-09-09 06:54:04+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': "@username_2 I've checked in the changes for the team in the yaml", 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}]

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: WIP: tests: Convert from testify to quicktest
username_0: 
<issue_comment>username_0: Here is a Perl-compatible list of regexps, if someone out there is about to do the same one day:

```bash
s/assert := require.New\(t\)/c := qt.New(t)/g;
s/assert\.Equal\(t, (.*?), (.*)\)/c.Assert(\2, qt.Equals, \1)/g;
s/assert\.Equal\((.*?), (.*)\)/c.Assert(\2, qt.Equals, \1)/g;
s/assert\.NotEqual\((.*?), (.*)\)/c.Assert(\2, qt.Not(qt.Equals), \1)/g;
s/require\.Equal\(t, (.*?), (.*)\)/c.Assert(\2, qt.Equals, \1)/g;
s/assert\.NoError\((.*),?\)/c.Assert(\1, qt.IsNil)/g;
s/assert\.Error\((.*),?\)/c.Assert(\1, qt.Not(qt.IsNil))/g;
s/require\.NoError\(t, (.*)\)/c.Assert(\1, qt.IsNil)/g;
s/require\.NoError\(b, (.*)\)/c.Assert(\1, qt.IsNil)/g;
s/require\.NoError\(th, (.*)\)/th.Assert(\1, qt.IsNil)/g;
s/require\.NotEmpty\(t, (.*)\)/c.Assert(\1, qt.Not(qt.HasLen), 0)/g;
s/require\.NotEmpty\(b, (.*)\)/c.Assert(\1, qt.Not(qt.HasLen), 0)/g;
s/require\.Empty\(t, (.*)\)/c.Assert(\1, qt.HasLen, 0)/g;
s/require\.Error\(t, (.*)\)/c.Assert(\1, qt.Not(qt.IsNil))/g;
s/require\.NotNil\(t, (.*)\)/c.Assert(\1, qt.Not(qt.IsNil))/g;
s/require\.NotNil\(b, (.*)\)/c.Assert(\1, qt.Not(qt.IsNil))/g;
s/require\.Nil\(t, (.*)\)/c.Assert(\1, qt.IsNil)/g;
s/assert\.NotNil\((.*)\)/c.Assert(\1, qt.Not(qt.IsNil))/g;
s/assert\.Nil\((.*)\)/c.Assert(\1, qt.IsNil)/g;
s/assert\.True\((.*)\)/c.Assert(\1, qt.Equals, true)/g;
s/require\.True\(t, (.*)\)/c.Assert(\1, qt.Equals, true)/g;
s/require\.True\(th, (.*)\)/th.Assert(\1, qt.Equals, true)/g;
s/require\.False\(t, (.*)\)/c.Assert(\1, qt.Equals, false)/g;
s/require\.False\(th, (.*)\)/th.Assert(\1, qt.Equals, false)/g;
s/assert\.False\((.*)\)/c.Assert(\1, qt.Equals, false)/g;
s/assert\.Contains\((.*?), (.*)\)/c.Assert(\1, qt.Contains, \2)/g;
s/require\.Contains\(t, (.*?), (.*)\)/c.Assert(\1, qt.Contains, \2)/g;
s/assert\.Len\((.*?), (.*)\)/c.Assert(len(\1), qt.Equals, \2)/g;
s/require\.Len\(t, (.*?), (.*)\)/c.Assert(len(\1), qt.Equals, \2)/g;
```

It's not perfect and I have omitted the replacements for imports in the above, but it's ccertainly faster than doing everything by hand ...
<issue_comment>username_1: @username_0 
A couple of thoughts about those conversions:

1. You could use `gofmt -r` to do the conversions, which would cope better with all expressions:

    gofmt -w -r 'assert.Equal(t, a, b) -> c.Assert(b, qt.Equals, a)'

2. The equivalent of `assert.Equal` is actually `qt.DeepEquals`, because `assert.Equal` uses `reflect.DeepEqual` under the hood.

3. You might want to convert `assert.X` to `c.Check` not `c.Assert` because the testify `assert` package does not call `t.Fatal` on failure. The counterpart of `c.Assert` is the [require package](https://godoc.org/github.com/stretchr/testify/require).

4. You can use `qt.HasLen` rather than `len` - that way you get nicer failure messages that show the actual content.
<issue_comment>username_0: Thanks. Not sure why I keep forgetting about the powers of `gofmt -w- r` ...
